Reviews.Title: “Great facility, but management not there”
Reviews.Author: fritzrobertson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Champaign to visit our daughter, and while we loved the city, this hotel left a lot to be desired. First of all, the breakfast is only "hot" for about an hour, which is a problem. Another interesting thing about the breakfast is that the entire time we were there (for 3 days) there was no butter or margarine available. Seems like something that should be taken care of, and people had definitely complained. The people working the front desk were rarely at the front desk. In fact, in three days, going out frequently for walks, to go see our daughter, or just going to the pool or to breakfast (I would get up early enough to get a hot breakfast; my wife slept in so she was out of luck) I saw a person actually behind the front desk once. Each time i had a question I had to shout for someone to come to the desk. There was a back room not visible to any guest and the front desk person would eventually emerge from there. There was no way to let someone know (no ringer, bell, etc.) that you needed assistance, so I just got used to shouting. I didn't bring a computer so I was using the business center to check emails and do some work. On the second day of our stay early in the morning both computers crashed. I went and got the front desk person, who of course was in the back room. He made some attempt to solve the problem with the computers, could not make anything happen, and said he would call the "computer guys" who would fix them that day. When I checked the next morning, nothing had been fixed, of course, and I am pretty sure no one had been contacted to attempt to correct the problem. On the second day of our stay, I noticed that the pool towels were dwindling to next to nothing, so I went to the front desk and asked if some could be brought in. He assured me this would happen but the next morning when I went for a swim there was only one towel. While I was swimming, a guy came in to empty and clean the hot tub. He appeared to be a maintenance person who does this kind of work for the hotel. Two other ladies and I were hoping to use the hot tub but the process of emptying and cleaning the hot tub made that impossible. I guess doing this before pool hours isn't possible. The guy did go and get some towels for us, since there was only just the one. Finally it was time to check out and start a drive to Chicago to see our other daughter. I went to the front desk. Of course no one was there. I rapped on the counter, then shouted a few times. Nothing. Waited a minute or so. A nice woman who was cleaning the lobby saw I wanted to talk to the front desk person so she called a number, and I heard the phone ringing, for quite awhile. No one answered. At last the front desk guy emerged from the back room, telling me "Sorry, I had to deal with about six phone calls." I knew that was b.s. (at least I'm pretty sure it was) and let him know that, plus some of the other complaints about our stay. He was almost entirely unapologetic and offered nothing. So here's my warning on this hotel. It's a very nice facility, the rooms are fine, the pool is ok, etc. But the management isn't paying attention to the breakfast (it really is simple to keep the type of hot breakfast items the hotel provides--scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon--warm for the full time breakfast is served, 6:30-9:30, but this isn't happening; and for heaven's sakes, someone could get some margarine eventually, one would hope), and there must be something happening in the back room behind the front desk that is very exciting because that's where the people who should answer a guest's questions always are. I'm sure Wingate doesn't want that kind of customer service at its hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Job”
Reviews.Author: zahnpilot
Reviews.Content: Traveling on an extended stay for work so I am trying a number of hotels in the area 1 week at a time and was very impressed with the Wingate. Close to the interstate, major restaurants, nice clean room, freshly stocked every day and the pool/hot tub was enjoyable on the couple of times I used them. Normally, a "good" three circle hotel, but the service warrants four! Upon arrival late Sunday night, I was promptly greeted to check in. Was even ask what floor I preferred as they had capacity and if I had any questions about the area. Very impressed given the recent horrible experience I experienced at a different hotel (HI) the week before. A couple of issues - my room keys on the 3rd day did not work but the front desk quickly fixed the problem and even explained magnetic device (cell phone, etc) might have knocked out the card if they were next to each other. Second was the internet speed. Ok for first 2 nights but afterwards, not acceptable for wireless. My 3G phone connection was faster (I tested it). Otherwise, great experience and I would recommend to others in the area. Mid-priced and much less than others in the area that had much worse service. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: sithlord66
Reviews.Content: Champaign is the central point between Des Moines and family in Kentucy. The Wingate is a nice place to rendezvous. Clean rooms and the very pet friendly. The breakfast kept me from giving a 5 rating across the board but it is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway!”
Reviews.Author: caratstone
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late Sat night. Check-in clerk first gave two rooms far away from each other, then found two almost adjoining. He was very nice. Nice workout room, and nice pool. All staff were friendly. Breakfast was good and not rushed..they didn't close down at the stroke of 9:30, and coffee was still available later. Lots of cheaper places nearby, but I think this was worth the nominally higher rate. Cheapest rate for me was found on their own site! The room was very large...one big room with bed towards the far end near the window, and sitting area nearer the door. Microwave and fridge were good to have in the room. (Bring popcorn!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good value, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: 30043ron
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Champaign to visit family and booked at neighboring hotel property. Unfortunately due to a flooding incident in a nearby room, we checked out at 11:45 p.m. as firetrucks and an ambulance headed our way. We remembered that Wingate had great Trip Advisor reviews when we made our original booking and decided to inquire and give it a try. The staff was most helpful, made last minute accommodations and helped us get situated. The room was well-appointed, even if a little small, and the breakfast was ample.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bbmom36382
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here the last 2 years during my daughter's basketball tournaments and both times I was very happy. The rooms are spacious, well / modernly decorated and clean. It is very nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room. There are 4 very comfortable pillows on each bed, ample towels. There were no issues with drains or anything else for that matter either year I was there as one reviewer stated. The breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast: scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, pastries and more. The hotel is very clean, people are friendly and helpful and I would highly recommend it. Good location, close to interstate and several good restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia4227
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting our daughter for Dad's Weekend. Clean, friendly front desk, Very nice bathroom, decent breakfast. We will stay here again, next year. On the outskirts of campus, but not bad. Not walking distance. Located near the Macy's Mall. One block to Panera.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and airy.”
Reviews.Author: purplefleece
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for two years running. The rooms are large and clean, comfortable beds. Fridge, ice in hallway, helpful staff. Very basic breakfast which I didn't eat much partly because the food is unhealthy and low quality but also breakfast is taken in the foyer where there has been a drains problem. The woman in charge of breakfast was very friendly and helpful. Lots of families for little league type sports at weekends. Can be active at weekends. Lots of parking spaces. You can see woodchucks on the grass next door! It is located in the hotel district quite a distance from the centre of Champaign but a very short drive from the shopping malls and loads of restaurants. Very difficult to find quality, healthy food..... Hopefully the problem of the smell if sewage/drains has been resolved. Maybe it has been by now. I stayed there in May 2011. Great place and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Champaign area”
Reviews.Author: pdrane56
Reviews.Content: We think this is a good choice. The rooms are always very clean, and the sound prooffing is also good. Wi-fi connection works great. On this last visit, my husband tried to use the pool and the water was too cold. He said the hot tub wasn't very hot either. We did see some kids in it later during the weekend - so it either warmed up or kids don't care. I wish they had some better breakfast options. One day there were bananas but they weren't anywhere nearly ripe, otherwise it is heavy on the carbs with some yogurt as one of the healthy options. I agree that the coffee needs improvement, it is not hot, and it is weak. But overall - we've been pleased when we stay here. Love the fact that they have a refrigerator in the room - that is one reason I chose this over the Country Inn and Suites which is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zimmdj
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in any Wingate's yet so wasn't sure what it was going to be like. I really enjoyed my room, very quiet and clean. The carpet was a little worn and the alarm clock did not work but...other than that, very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for price”
Reviews.Author: SusanShawnee
Reviews.Content: Room was large and clean and quiet. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “solid”
Reviews.Author: hoby1kanobee
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights there. was during incredible heat wave. hvac worked fine. typical breakfast though hot water wasn't hot enough for hot chocolate, and coffee quality was weak. "health club" consisted solely of stationary bike, treadmill, and elliptical, which worked fine. Indoor pool looked nice but didn't use. room had microwave and fridge which was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganderMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Champaign and were given a room on the first floor----this place must have terrific insulation for it was so quiet---no sound of doors opening or people walking on the floor above us. The bed was very comfortable----I didn't check to see if it was a Beauty Rest like we have a home but we were not bothered with movement when we turned or got up---the linens were quality too. The cleanliness of the room was excellent and the shower had great pressure with lots of hot water. The breakfast was delicious with lots of choices. The room microwave and refrigerator were nice touches. Once again we checked the TripAdvisor site and were very pleased with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdrenoll
Reviews.Content: We arrived late to this hotel and were greeted by a friendly clerk who checked us in promptly. The hotel was clean and the room was nicely decorated and roomy and the beds were very comforable. Extra towels were delivered quickly when we requested them, check-out was done without my going to the desk. The free breakfast was great offering eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit and much more. Great hotel, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: cadp52
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was what we expected. Only two real issues to comment on - front desk staff was non-existent at check-in. We very nearly left for the Country Inn & Suites next door. We experienced the same problem when we checked out. Also our room on the second floor experienced alot of noise from the floor above. But for the price, it was a great value and a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, spotless rooms-just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Evansthecat
Reviews.Content: I was greeted warmly on a snowy, cold evening and offered a choice of 2nd or 3rd floor. In retrospect, I should have chosen third because it became apparent there were some high energy children in the room above me. Fortunately they must have gone to bed by 9. This was only a minor annoyance in a very nice stay (two nights) overall. Either the hotel is new or they have a great maintenance team because everything was in good repair and spotless. The room temp was comfortable. I loved having the digital thermostat on an interior wall so that I could make the adjustments I needed. The bath was nice and the toiletries were pleasant. I had one king bed in an enormous room with a large flatscreen TV, a pod coffeemaker and plenty of storage space. The bed was great and the linens smelled fresh. I think there were at least 4 pillows and a bolster. The pool and work out room looked nice, but I didn't use them. The breakfast area was premiere. The attendant was friendly and really worked hard to keep things stocked and cleaned. In many motels the breakfast area looks like an after thought shoved into a corner, but it was clear that it was an important part of this hotels hospitality. There were 12 four top tables, so even if the place had high occupancy there would be no wait for a seat. Holiday decorations were kept to a tasteful, unobstrusive level.

Reviews.Title: “When on business trips, this is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gail S
Reviews.Content: The front desk was efficient and friendly. The room was very clean and smelled nice but not overly flowery which I hate. It was near a ton of restaurants and right near the interstate and easy to find. It had a nice pool area and a nice parking lot. Could have used a slightly bigger breakfast area when there's a busload of kids staying there, and they could have used a little more help in the breakfast area when they were having a rush of kids that were there to attend a sporting event. Overall, I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: redbug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way to take daughter to college in Minnesota. Clean and comfy. Nice linens and very comfy beds, nice breakfast. Great front desk personnel. Night clerk was very nice. Liked it so much we stayed on the way back as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice among the newer CU properties”
Reviews.Author: clvier1
Reviews.Content: As a nearly 20-year resident of Champaign, having moved away last summer, I had occasion to need a hotel for one night. Lucky for me a number of nicer newer properties have been constructed; the Hilton Garden Inn and Homewood Suites, and the Wyndham Wingate (and they apparently have taken over the old Hawthorne Suites on Neil, which had been declining for years). Anyway: Pros: Great location not too far from downtown Champaign (many good independent dining choices and bars) and close to mall and grocery stores. Decorating and finishing done with care (it is a newer property, too). Breakfast in pleasant, open dining area with eggs and sausage the day I was there, both were good. 24 hour business center and convenience store with snacks, drinks, etc. Keycard required after hours to gain any entrance at all. Pool/sauna area pleasant if small. Rooms laid out thoughtfully - sleeping area, desk/lounging area/bathroom, all distinct. Spacious room with nice amenities. Electronic thermostat functions well and HVAC is quiet. Great flatscreens with 50-60 channel choices. Only caveat is the bathroom, whilel outfitted handsomely, has a rather high counter and a bulge that takes away valuable room - careful when exiting the room. Well done place and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel & Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BellaBoo00
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 kids (ages 10, 5, 1) and big dog stayed in a 2 queen room. the room was very clean everyday (especially after the mess my kids made). They greeted us at the front desk every day. The morning breakfast was fresh (kids like making the waffles the best). The housekeepers were also very friendly after my 5 yr old vomitted all over the bed sheets (twice) and we asked for additional sheets. they cleaned the mess and was very courteous. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in town. This is one of the best hotels we ever stayed in. I will look for this hotel in other cities we visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: be_elle_kay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 3 nights, in a queen double room. The room was beautifully decorated, very clean, and everything was in working order. I personally liked that there was a digital thermostat in the room - and when the air/heat came on, it was not noticeable. My only negative thing that I would have to say is that the room is slightly cramped. The desk chair always seemed to be in the way (we ended up moving it out from under the desk and up against a wall). The bathroom, while lovely, was also small. I am about 5 foot 8, and when I was changing in the bathroom, my fingers hit the ceiling. I believe the website mentions that there are curved shower rods in the shower. Yes, this is true, but it doesn't seem to add space because the show rods are mounted only 30 inches from the wall - so at the widest point it only seems like a regularly sized shower (hopefully that makes sense). The bathroom counter/sink is taller than your standard counter height, which I really liked. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Included with the price of the stay was breakfast. Nothing fancy (bagel, english muffins, toast, cereals, instant oatmeal, a waffle maker, yogurt, fruit, muffins, assorted juices, coffee, tea and some scrambled eggs) - but I really was happy to have it. We traveled wtih 2 small girls, so it was convenient having food right in the hotel, and it was also very nice that it was "free" since our girls can be picky eaters sometimes. They love cereal, but who wants to go to an actual restaurant and pay 3.99 for a bowl of cereal? Not me. The woman in the breakfast area on the weekend was very helpful and friendly. The pool was nice. Chilly, but nice and clean. The hot tub was nice and warm. Although I did not use the fitness center, I peeked in and on occassion saw other guest using the machines and they seemed to be in working order. Overall, everything was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I plan to stay here the next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: VaibhavGupta
Reviews.Content: It was my business trip and hotel was booked by my company. Location is very nice. Shopping places like Marketplace, Kohl's, Target are all nearby. Breakfast was great. Yes, on weekends hallways seems to be noisy as there were kids playing all around.

Reviews.Title: “Always confirm reservation, even when booking online through their website.”
Reviews.Author: need2retire
Reviews.Content: We booked online through Wingate website, but were told when we arrived that the Manager had "modified" our reservation. Apparently they had overbooked (imagine that) a suite, so bumped us since we were the last ones to register. Tried to put us in a "double" instead, and then asked us to pay an additional $20 to upgrade! I don't think so! Explained to them that this was simply not the way to do business and they agreed to put us in a King room, but not a suite. Otherwise, hotel was very nice, breakfast was great and atmosphere was very pleasing....except for hallways seemed very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TooMuch43
Reviews.Content: You know how it is when you go on line to book a hotel stay and you hope that everything meets it's reviews and that the rooms actually do look like they do on their web site well let me tell ya, the Wingate in Champaing, Illinois was beyond all that. From the point of booking the trip on the phone to walking through the doors of the hotel to the nice warm breakfast and especially the curtious staff our stay here was one of the best I've had. Thank you to the day manager Chris Huber and his staff for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but not as good as it sounded”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2MM
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, it sounded like this hotel would be perfect for our stay with family. The room was nice and good sized. There was some hair on tub and on floor in bathroom but I can overlook that. Bathroom was nice but if you are short, you may have a problem leaning over the sink because it is very high and recessed back. The worst and most upsetting part was the pool and hot tub. We stayed an extra day just so the kids could swim at at 11:50am they were cleaning it and put new water in hot tub. It was FREEZING and we couldn't even get in the pool (even the kids didn't want to) and the hot tub was so cold, we couldn't sit down in it. After waiting about 30 minutes, it finally warmed up enough to get in and the kids had to "swim" in there. So disappointing when we spent the money to stay and swim. They did not apologize or anything and just told us they had cleaned it. Breakfast buffet was 'ok'. Orange juice was very watery and almost undrinkable. Had the make your own waffles, sausage links, scrambled eggs, toast, bagels, cereal, and very green bananas. The suite was very nice (a family member was in one)!! It worked great for our family Christmas get together and had a large living room/dining room combo. A table that seated 4 and wet bar with lots of room and storage. Huge bathroom and bedroom. Nice LCD, flat screen TV's. We had 12 people in the suite and were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Price- Nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Msullivan66
Reviews.Content: Stayed over night while visiting U of Illinois for one day. We usually stay in a suite while traveling, but since it was only one day, we were looking for something clean, nice and affordable. After reading the Tripadvisor reviews, I went with the Wingate by Wyndham. At first I was skeptical since I got a room on a Saturday night for about $85. When we arrived, the hotel, room and amenities were EXACTLY as other reviewers had described. The room was nice and comfortable, the bathroom was big enough and the location was perfect. The only issue we had during our stay was the customer service from the front desk during check-in; the agent was obviously having a bad day and we don't let one person negatively impact our experience. This will be our first choice when returning to Champaign; my wife loved the mall one block away!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: Lehee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while on a road trip to Memphis. We throughly enjoyed our time at this hotel. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is appointed beautifully and very comfortable. We appreciated the microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker in our room. The breakfast area was well stocked and kept clean and tidy during the breakfast service. Easy access to the expressway and local restaurants. I highly recommend to anyone that they should stay here while in the Champaign-Urbana area.

Reviews.Title: “Newer motel, nicely furnished”
Reviews.Author: luvtodrive
Reviews.Content: New since about March 2009, clean, quiet, nice furnishings, quick checkin, but I was given a keycard to an already-occupied room. Lucky for them, there was another room available. Hey, stuff happens. I did make sure to keep my security lock on though. The staff was friendly. Rates were reasonable (I chose the non-refundable rate, saving about $10-20). Breakfast bar was nice, with a do-it-yourself waffles machine, scrambled eggs, sausage, mini-pastries, bagels, bread, cereal, juices, fruit (though it looked a little old - the oranges were kind of shriveled).

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay In Champaign”
Reviews.Author: traverlerjack
Reviews.Content: This is one the nicest places I've stayed in, certainly the best in the Champaign-Urbana area. The entrance lobby is beautiful and clean. This hotel is new within the last 6 months. The place is impeccably clean. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable in fact one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. The room has a flat screened TV which has plenty of cable channels. The bathroom was beautiful with a very comfortable shower. The pool area with the whirlpool next to it are very nice. The pool & whirlpool water temperatures were just right. The complimentary breakfast was fine. The make-your-own waffles were delicious. The eating area was quite spacious and comfortable seating and clean tables. You can watch TV on the lobby's huge flat screened TV while you eat. If you need a place to stay in the the Champaign-Urbana whether business or leisure I guarantee this is the one! I surely was impressed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CaduceusONE
Reviews.Content: Recommend! Incredible service. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotels that I have stayed in on business. Accommodating to out of town guests. Convenient location. Clean! Comfortable, Quiet, Pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Champaign”
Reviews.Author: keepermom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty new. I think we may have been the first to stay in our room. The location is great, about 10 minutes to the University but just 5 minutes to 2 main shopping areas. One large mall with Macys and Berengers and the other area has Staples, WalMart, Target etc. Breakfast is included in price and 2 out of 3 mornings included the make it yourself waffles *yum*. There were also hot eggs and sausage patties each morning. The coffee was excellent. The room (2 queens) was very spacious and had a desk with chair as well as a chair/ottoman combo. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was very quiet. It is in a bit from the highway so much quieter than some places we have stayed. The front desk and breakfast room staff were always very friendly and greeted us each time we entered and left. My only issues: water pressure wasn't the best however, this may be a regional thing. Cheese omeletes weren't labeled on the breakfest buffet. I don't eat cheese and just thought it was a scrambled type dish. Not a great surprise.

HotelInfo.Name: Wingate By Wyndham Champaign
HotelInfo.Address: 516 West Marketview Drive, Champaign, IL 61822
